item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support :D Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Cyberpunk
item.description: The cyberpunk design style is a futuristic, sci-fi style that is filled with neon and punk culture. The style is bursting with, well, style.

item.title: Design Project
item.description: Design Project Directory: [[notes/Business-Cards|Business-Cards]] [[notes/Logos|Logos]] [[notes/Website|Website]] Brief: What am I creating?: My plan is to design and create all the relevant designs and graphical material for both my upcoming game as well as my own game studio behind the game.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Inquiry Standard
item.description: [[notes/Inquiry-Standard-Research|Inquiry-Standard-Research]] Inquiry Focus Design and create a mobile app to help my dad track and organize his bike mechanic repair jobs.

item.title: Inquiry Standard Research
item.description: Existing Products - General Time Management Asana: What is it?: Asana is a general purpose project\time management software suite that allows teams to better organize their time.

item.title: Japan
item.description: Japan¬†is an¬†island country¬†in¬†East Asia. It is situated in the northwest¬†Pacific Ocean¬†and is bordered on the west by the¬†Sea of Japan, extending from the¬†Sea of Okhotsk¬†in the north toward the¬†East China Sea,¬†Philippine Sea, and¬†Taiwan¬†in the south.

item.title: Mixer - Python Music Player
item.description: pygame.mixer.music.load() Load a music file for playback load(filename) -> None load(object) -> None This will load a music filename/file object and prepare it for playback.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Listed here are all of the current and past projects that I have worked on Current Projects: [[notes/Blinding-nights|Blinding-nights]] [[notes/Design-project|Design-project]] [[notes/Inquiry-Standard|Inquiry-Standard]] [[notes/projects/Blinding-Nights/HTML-Standard]] Past Projects: [[notes/Python-Music-Player|Python-Music-Player]]

item.title: Python Music Player
item.description: Brief: Create a simple python music player that can control music and have music added to it via importing files. This music player is built with the python tkinter library in order to give it a graphical user interface or GUI.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: ‚Äú[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!

item.title: Ver 0.1 - Python Music Player
item.description: Changelog: Created base player UI Added all components to the UI Started documentation

item.title: Ver 0.1 - Python Music Player
item.description: Changelog: Added the ability to play .mp3 files through the player screen Planning for the ability to add music to the player Partial functionality for changing song
